title: Support of Compare REST API
body:
Hello folks, is that API supported by the lib?
https://github.blog/changelog/2021-03-22-compare-rest-api-now-supports-pagination/

Best regards and thanks, Max

title: Add support of review_requested event
body:
# Description

Add support of review_requested issue event

Will close https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/issues/1198

title: Issue Events API does not include the `requestedReviewer`
body:
**Describe the bug**
An issue event can be of many types, one of which is `REVIEW_REQUESTED`, in which case the event object in the API response would contains a field called `review_requester` which is user who has been requested to review this PR.
Unfortunately this field has been missed in the `GHIssueEvent` class.

**To Reproduce**
Github API
`GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{issue_number}/events`

title: Search API not supporting "page" parameter.
body:
Hi, thanks for providing the GitHub API client; it has been a great help for us.

But there's an issue we have with the `searchIssues()`:
How can we query the search API by passing the `page` and `per_page` making sure that the client only fetches those addressed items?

For example, we need something like this:
```
client.searchIssues()
    .sort(GHIssueSearchBuilder.Sort.UPDATED)
    .order(GHDirection.DESC)
    .q("type:pr is:open")
    .list()
    .atPage(2)
    .withPageSize(10);
```
- Please note that **atPage** is not supported at the moment.
- Also, we don't want the client to fetch all of the items from GitHub but just the ones we've requested for.
- This would be the resulting URL of our request:
`https://api.github.com/search/issues?q=type:pr%20is:open&sort=updated&order=desc&page=2&per_page=10`

I saw some discussion regarding `PagedIterable` #348 but I'm not sure if that resolves our issue.

Thanks in advance.

title: Add tests for GHContentUpdatedResponse
body:
# Description

#1185 discovered a problem in `GHContentUpdatedResponse`.

The `commit` field in `GHContentUpdatedResponse` actually matches up to the `GHCommit.ShortCommitInfo` rather than `GHCommit`.  The means that most of the fields are misaligned and set to null when returned.  However, `GHCommit` can recover by populating and then returning info as normal. 

This is not a great solution, but it show that this part of the API is only less than optimal,
not completely broken.

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

- [ ] Push your changes to a branch other than `main`. Create your PR from that branch.
- [ ] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [ ] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [ ] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above.
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Update javadocs for GHPullRequestFileDetail
body:
# Description

In order to fix https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/issues/486, JavaDocs for GHPullRequestFileDetail was updated.

Fixes #486.

title: Add ability to search repos by fork and visibility
body:
# Description

Updated GHRepositorySearchBuilder.java, add ability to search repos by fork:(true|only) and visibility:(public|private|internal)

This one issue https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/issues/1174 should be closed after merge.

Fixes #1174

title: Add getAppInstallations(/user/installations) method on GHMyself
body:
# Description

Add  getAppInstallations (under the hood call on /user/installations) method in GHMyself

For more info pls take a look at https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/apps#list-app-installations-accessible-to-the-user-access-token

title: Get non-PullRequest issues
body:
Hi,

Thanks for this awesome tool. I am quite enjoying working on it.

Just wanted to know, is there any way to get only issues without getting pull requests? When I am requesting getIssue(), I am getting all the pull requests inside the response which can lead to rate limiting.

Thanks

title: Fix commit property in GHContentUpdateResponse
body:
# Description

`GHContentUpdateResponse.commit` seems to be different from `GHCommit` according to API reference:
https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-or-update-file-contents

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

- [x] Push your changes to a branch other than `main`. Create your PR from that branch.

- [x] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.

# When creating a PR: 

- [x] Fill in the "Description" above.
- [x] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Remove @Deprecated annotation from Preview and BetaApi elements
body:
# Description
The use of `@Deprecated` annotations to on `Preview` and `BetaApi` elements is a continuing source of confusion for users.  While it is important to maintain compatibility and communicate the "Preview" state to users, the `@Deprecated` annotation is simply not the right way to do it.  

This change removes all the `@Deprecated` annotations for that scenario. After this change, all methods marked as `@Deprecated` will actually be deprecated and will eventually be removed. 

Fixes #1003

@gsmet @yeikel 


# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

- [ ] Push your changes to a branch other than `main`. Create your PR from that branch.
- [ ] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [ ] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [ ] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

# When creating a PR: 

- [ ] Fill in the "Description" above.
- [ ] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Add list projects method for GHUser
body:
# Description

As was mentioned in https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/issues/924, there is no method in GHUser to retrieve user project boards.
In scope of this PR listProjects method was added in GHUser.

title: 401 Bad credentials errors coming up since yesterday
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have been using the ghprb plugins in our jenkins, and things have been working fine so far.
Since yesterday, I found that the once I create a PullRequest on github - the jenkins job was not starting.

On checking the logs, I am getting errors for the following URLs:
```
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/users/AbdealiJK
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/rate_limit
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/repos/GITHUB_ORG/GITHUB_REPO/pulls/37/commits
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/repos/GITHUB_ORG/GITHUB_REPO/pulls/37
```
The error is:
```
Caused: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 401 for URL: https://api.github.com/...
...
Caused: org.kohsuke.github.HttpException: {"message":"Bad credentials","documentation_url":"https://docs.github.com/rest"}
```

Things I have checked:
 - Jenkins is receiving the webhooks correctly for ghprb, but when it is trying to process the pull request and create a job - it fails
 - The credentials configured in jenkins and github have not been changed
 - No Jenkins configs were changed for atleast the last week
 - After this issue arose - I've updated Jenkins and all plugins. Updating them did not fix the problem
 - When I login to the jenkins server and do `curl https://api.github.com/users/AbdealiJK` it works fine.

**Jenkins information (and git related plugins)**:
```
Jenkins 2.289.1
Git Parameter Plug-In (git-parameter): 0.9.13
Pipeline: GitHub (pipeline-github): 2.7
Git client plugin (git-client): 3.7.2
GitHub Pull Request Builder (ghprb): 1.42.2
GitHub Branch Source Plugin (github-branch-source): 2.11.1
Git plugin (git): 4.7.2
GitHub plugin (github): 1.33.1
Pipeline GitHub Notify Step Plugin (pipeline-githubnotify-step): 1.0.5
GIT server Plugin (git-server): 1.9
GitHub API Plugin (github-api): 1.123
```

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome 91

Full log:
```
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM FINE org.jenkinsci.plugins.ghprb.GhprbTrigger$DescriptorImpl getRepoTriggers
Found project [JENKINS_PROJECT] for webhook repo [GITHUB_ORG/GITHUB_REPO]
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM INFO org.jenkinsci.plugins.ghprb.GhprbTrigger handlePR
Checking PR #37 for job JENKINS_PROJECT
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM FINE org.kohsuke.github.GitHubClient sendRequest
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/users/AbdealiJK
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM FINE org.kohsuke.github.GitHubClient updateRateLimit
Rate limit now: GHRateLimit {core {remaining=45, limit=60, resetDate=Thu Jun 10 05:10:24 UTC 2021}, search {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}, graphql {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}, integrationManifest {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}}
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM SEVERE org.jenkinsci.plugins.ghprb.GhprbPullRequest getAuthorEmail
Unable to fetch author info for 37
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM INFO org.jenkinsci.plugins.ghprb.GhprbPullRequest 
Created Pull Request #37 on GITHUB_ORG/GITHUB_REPO by AbdealiJK () updated at: 6/9/21 1:17 PM SHA: 3b40c338bbd67f278f600ab6dce9d0dcf3b850fa
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM FINE org.kohsuke.github.GitHubClient sendRequest
GitHub API request [anonymous]: GET https://api.github.com/users/AbdealiJK
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM FINE org.kohsuke.github.GitHubClient updateRateLimit
Rate limit now: GHRateLimit {core {remaining=44, limit=60, resetDate=Thu Jun 10 05:10:24 UTC 2021}, search {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}, graphql {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}, integrationManifest {remaining=999999, limit=1000000, resetDate=Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 UTC 1970}}
Jun 10, 2021 4:34:19 AM SEVERE org.jenkinsci.plugins.ghprb.GhprbPullRequest updatePR
Exception caught while updating the PR
```

title: Adds category name for releases
Regarding deprecated methods with Apps , GHAppInstallationToken.getRepositories() returns null
Issue rename event do not contains issue old name
Unable to getOrganization - data truncated

title: Add mapping for from/to fields in issue rename event
body:
# Description

Issue rename event do not include information about previous(old) name.

According to the [docs](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/events/issue-event-types#renamed)  response  contain rename object with from/to properties for previous/new name. Mappings for this fields were added in scope of this PR.

title: Improvement: Include Forked repositories in GHRepositorySearchBuilder
body:
As a user of your library,
I want to use the GHRepositorySearchBuilder class to find my forked repositories
so that I'm able to automate fetch upstream.

#### Current implementation

The GHRepositorySearchBuilder has a **forks** method. But this is for searching for how many time a repository was forked and not if the repository itself is a fork.

#### Expected implementation

Add a fork method to GHRepositorySearchBuilder so that t can add the parameters true or only to search for repositories that I have forked.

#### References

- https://docs.github.com/en/github/searching-for-information-on-github/searching-on-github/searching-for-repositories

1527.ve41b3ce15c05

Note to any external users: Stapler is now being published directly to the Jenkins Artifactory server; we no longer publish to Maven Central via OSSRH. (Publishing to Central was already spottyвЂ”security releases did not make it there.) If your project uses Stapler and does not already inherit from a Jenkins project parent POM, you will need to add

<repositories>
  <repository>
    <id>repo.jenkins-ci.org</id>
    <url>https://repo.jenkins-ci.org/public/</url>
  </repository>
</repositories>

to receive updates.

title: Support creating discussions from releases
body:
A discussion may be linked to a release upon creation or update if a `discussion_category_name` field is set.

https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#create-a-release requires POST
https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#update-a-release requires PATCH

title: Chore(deps-dev): Bump archunit from 0.18.0 to 0.19.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: java
labels.description: Pull requests that update Java code

body:
Bumps [archunit](https://github.com/TNG/ArchUnit) from 0.18.0 to 0.19.0.
Release notes

Sourced from archunit's releases.

ArchUnit 0.19.0

Bug Fixes

  • The last release archive contained a couple of classes from dependencies that were not relocated and thus lead to duplicate classes warnings in some environments. These classes have been removed (see #593)

Enhancements

Core

  • JavaField now knows its generic type (retrievable via JavaField.getType()). Furthermore type arguments of generic field types are now part of the JavaClass.directDependencies{From/To}Self (see #595; thanks a lot to @вЂ‹hankem for extensive reviews)

Lang

  • new method noClasses()...should().transitivelyDependOnClassesThat(..)... (see #575; thanks a lot to @вЂ‹hankem)
  • the failure descriptions of ArchRules can not be customized (see #343; thanks a lot to @вЂ‹Farbauti89)

Library

  • new method layeredArchitecture()...mayOnlyAccessLayers(..)... (see #592; thanks a lot to @вЂ‹GiorgadzeLuka)
  • improved readability for cycle rule violations (see #369; thanks a lot to @вЂ‹jzheaux)
  • FreezingArchRule can now refreeze all violations, if current violations should simply be added to the ViolationStore without any failure (see #510)

JUnit

  • annotations of test methods and fields are now passed to the TestDescription by the JUnit 4 test support (see #552)

Further Acknowledgement

  • Thanks a lot to @вЂ‹GiorgadzeLuka and @вЂ‹OLibutzki for improving the documentation
Commits
  • 6140cbc prepare release 0.19.0
  • 4b50cec pass annotations of rule fields and methods to JUnit test description #613
  • 7ca1d49 pass annotations of rule fields and methods to JUnit test description
  • e208a70 add property freeze.refreeze to allow overwriting the current store #612
  • e8fbae4 add property freeze.refreeze to allow overwriting the current store
  • 6a68905 Add generic field types #595
  • ff72a71 add generic field type argument dependencies from and to self
  • 0731c44 add generic type to JavaField
  • 52179d2 extract SignatureTypeArgumentProcessor to separate file
  • 1ccfbd6 rename TypeArgumentProcessor -> SignatureTypeArgumentProcessor
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.tngtech.archunit:archunit&package-manager=maven&previous-version=0.18.0&new-version=0.19.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. title: Chore(deps-dev): Bump gson from 2.8.6 to 2.8.7

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: java
labels.description: Pull requests that update Java code

body:
Bumps [gson](https://github.com/google/gson) from 2.8.6 to 2.8.7.
Changelog

Sourced from gson's changelog.

Version 2.8.7

  • Fixed ISO8601UtilsTest failing on systems with UTC+X.
  • Improved javadoc for JsonStreamParser.
  • Updated proguard.cfg (#1693).
  • Fixed IllegalStateException in JsonTreeWriter (#1592).
  • Added JsonArray.isEmpty() (#1640).
  • Added new test cases (#1638).
  • Fixed OSGi metadata generation to work on JavaSE < 9 (#1603).
Commits
  • 4520489 [maven-release-plugin] prepare release gson-parent-2.8.7
  • fa4a177 Add missing dependency for the release plugin.
  • 3a69469 Merge pull request #1894 from google/dependabot/maven/org.apache.maven.plugin...
  • d4fb033 Bump maven-javadoc-plugin from 3.2.0 to 3.3.0
  • 1e4b84c Merge pull request #1687 from Marcono1234/iso-utils-test-fix

title: Add packages, actions and dependabot to meta
body:
# Description
I've added packages, actions, and dependabot to GHMeta class. Thank you for your review! рџ?Ќ 

<!-- Describe your change here -->

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

- [x] Push your changes to a branch other than `main`. Create your PR from that branch.
- [x] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [x] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [x] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

# When creating a PR: 

- [x] Fill in the "Description" above.
- [x] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".
